subject: Programming
title: The Bitcoin Overflow Bug
description: A fast breakdown of The Bitcoin Overflow Bug for builders.

hook.text: In August 2010, someone created 184 billion Bitcoin out of thin air.

buildup.text: Bitcoin's code checked individual outputs but not the total. An integer overflow slipped through.

discovery.text: The transaction created coins far beyond the 21 million limit, breaking Bitcoin's core promise.

twist.text: Developers caught it within hours and rolled back the blockchain with an emergency patch.

climax.text: The incident proved that even decentralized, trustless systems depend on human code reviews.

punchline.text: An overflow nearly destroyed digital scarcity.

quiz.question: What type of bug created 184 billion Bitcoin?
